type.!doc: The type of the item: the Simple (without package) name of the Java Item type, such as 'Switch'.

label.!doc: The label attached to the item

state.!doc: The state of the item, as a string.

history.!doc: Access historical states for this item

semantics.!doc: Access the semantic features for this Item

rawState.!doc: The raw state of the item, as a java object.

members.!doc: Members / children / direct descendents of the current group Item (as returned by 'getMembers()'). Must be a group item.

descendents.!doc: All descendents of the current group Item (as returned by 'getAllMembers()'). Must be a group item.

tags.!doc: Gets the tags from this item

groupNames.!doc: Gets the groups for this item

getMetadataValue.!doc: Gets metadata values for this item.

updateMetadataValue.!doc: Updates metadata value for this item.

upsertMetadataValue.!doc: Inserts or updates metadata values for this item.

updateMetadataValues.!doc: Updates metadata values for this item.

sendCommand.!doc: Sends a command to the item.

sendCommandIfDifferent.!doc: Sends a command to the item, but only if the current state is not what is being sent.

postUpdate.!doc: Posts an update to the item

averageBetween.!doc: Gets the average value of the state of a given Item between two certain points in time.

averageSince.!doc: Gets the average value of the state of a given Item since a certain point in time.

changedBetween.!doc: Checks if the state of a given Item has changed between two certain points in time.

changedSince.!doc: Checks if the state of a given Item has changed since a certain point in time.

deltaBetween.!doc: Gets the difference value of the state of a given Item between two certain points in time.

deltaSince.!doc: Gets the difference value of the state of a given Item since a certain point in time.

deviationBetween.!doc: Gets the standard deviation of the state of the given Item between two certain points in time.

deviationSince.!doc: Gets the standard deviation of the state of the given Item since a certain point in time.

evolutionRateBetween.!doc: Gets the evolution rate of the state of a given Item between two certain points in time.

evolutionRateSince.!doc: Gets the evolution rate of the state of a given Item since a certain point in time.

historicState.!doc: Retrieves the historic Item state for a given Item at a certain point in time.

lastUpdate.!doc: Query the last update time of a given item.

latestState.!doc: Retrieves the historic Item state for a given Item at the current point in time.

maximumBetween.!doc: Gets the maximum value of the historic state of a given Item between two certain points in time.

maximumSince.!doc: Gets the historic Item with the maximum value of the state of a given Item since a certain point in time.

minimumBetween.!doc: Gets the minimum value of the historic state of a given Item between two certain points in time.

minimumSince.!doc: Gets the historic Item with the minimum value of the state of a given Item since a certain point in time.

persist.!doc: Persists the state of a given item

previousState.!doc: Returns the previous state of a given item.

sumBetween.!doc: Gets the sum of the states of a given Item between two certain points in time.

sumSince.!doc: Gets the sum of the state of a given Item since a certain point in time.

updatedBetween.!doc: Checks if the state of a given Item has been updated between two certain points in time.

updatedSince.!doc: Checks if the state of a given Item has been updated since a certain point in time.

varianceBetween.!doc: Gets the variance of the state of the given Item between two certain points in time.

varianceSince.!doc: Gets the variance of the state of the given Item since a certain point in time.

latestState.!doc: Retrieves the historic Item state for a given Item at the current point in time.

equipmentType.!doc: The type of the semantic equipment.

locationType.!doc: The type of the semantic location.

pointType.!doc: The type of the semantic point.

propertyType.!doc: The type of the semantic property.

semanticType.!doc: Determines the semantic type (i.e. a sub-type of Location, Equipment or Point).

channels.!doc: Channel links for the Item (see JS Scripting docs/Standard Library/Things).

metadata.!doc: Metadata for the Item (see JS Scripting docs/Standard Library/Things).

getItem.!doc: This method retrieves a single Item from the registry.

getItemsByTag.!doc: Returns a list of items containing all of the given tags.

addItem.!doc: Creates a new Item within openHAB (see JS Scripting docs/Standard Library/Items).

replaceItem.!doc: Replaces (upserts) an item. If an Item does not exist with this name, a new Item will be created with the supplied configuration (see JS Scripting docs/Standard Library/Items).

removeItem.!doc: Removes an Item from openHAB. The Item is removed immediately and cannot be recovered.

safeItemName.!doc: Helper function to ensure an Item name is valid. All invalid characters are replaced with an underscore.

isEnabled.!doc: Whether the Thing is enabled or not.

setLocation.!doc: Set the physical location of the Thing.

setProperty.!doc: Set the value of a property of the Thing.

getThing.!doc: Get a single Thing from openHAB.

shared.!doc: Shared cache that is shared across all rules and scripts, it can therefore be accessed from any automation language. A key is removed when all scripts that ever accessed it are unloaded, if the key stores a timer, the timer is cancelled.

private.!doc: Private cache for each script. It can only be accessed by the same script and is cleared when the script is unloaded. When the script is unloaded, all timers in the script are cancelled.

get.!doc: Returns the value to which the specified key is mapped. The optional defaultSupplier will return a default value if the key has no associated value.

put.!doc: Associates the specified value with the specified key.

remove.!doc: Removes the mapping for a key from this map if it is present.

exists.!doc: Checks whether a value is associated with the given key.

getExecutionTime.!doc: The scheduled execution time or null if timer was cancelled.

isActive.!doc: Whether the scheduled execution is yet to happen.

isCancelled.!doc: Whether the timer has been cancelled.

hasTerminated.!doc: Whether the scheduled execution has already terminated.

reschedule.!doc: Reschedules a timer to a new starting time. This can also be called after a timer has terminated, which will result in another execution of the same code.

toZDT.!doc: Converts nearly any representation of a time to a time.ZonedDateTime (see JS Scripting Docs/Standard Library/Time)

ZonedDateTime.!doc: Represents a date-time with a time offset and/or a time zone in the ISO-8601 calendar system (see JS Scripting Docs/Standard Library/Time).

atLevel.!doc: Logs a message at the supplied level. The message may include placeholders {} which will be substituted into the message string only if the message is actually logged.

itemName.!doc: The name of the Item that triggered the event (core.ItemStateUpdateTrigger, core.ItemStateChangeTrigger, core.ItemCommandTrigger). Attention: Java type!

itemState.!doc: The state of the Item that triggered the event (core.ItemStateUpdateTrigger, core.ItemStateChangeTrigger). Attention: Java type!

oldItemState.!doc: The previous state of the Item that triggered the event (core.ItemStateChangeTrigger). Attention: Java type!

itemCommand.!doc: The command of the Item that triggered the event (core.ItemCommandTrigger). Attention: Java type!

type.!doc: The event type (core.GenericEventTrigger). Attention: Java type!

postUpdate.!doc: Posts a status update for a specified Item to the event bus.

sendCommand.!doc: Sends a command for a specified Item to the event bus.

getDaysUntil.!type: fn(searchedHoliday: string, offsetOrDay?: ?, filename?: string) -> number

isInDayset.!type: fn(daysetName: string, offsetOrDay?: ?, filename?: string) -> bool

sendHttpGetRequest.!type: fn(url: string, headers?: object, timeout?: int) -> string

sendHttpPostRequest.!type: fn(url: string, contentType?: string, content?: string, headers?: object, timeout?: int) -> string

sendHttpPutRequest.!type: fn(url: string, contentType?: string, content?: string, headers?: object, timeout?: int) -> string

sendHttpDeleteRequest.!type: fn(url: string, headers?: object, timeout?: int) -> string

sendNotification.!doc: Sends a notification to a specific cloud instance user.

sendBroadcastNotification.!doc: Sends a notification to all devices of all users.

sendLogNotification.!doc: Sends a log notification to the notifications list at your openHAB Cloud instance. Notifications are NOT sent to any registered device.

checkVitality.!type: fn(host: string, port: int, timeout: int) -> boolean

createTimer.!doc: Schedules a function for later execution.
createTimer.!type: fn(identifier?: string, zonedDateTime: time.ZonedDateTime, function: fn()) -> Timer

transform.!doc: Applies a transformation of a given type with some function to a value. Returns the original value if the transformation fails.
transform.!type: fn(type: string, fn: string, value: string) -> string

transformRaw.!doc: Applies a transformation of a given type with some function to a value. Throws an error if the transformation fails.
transformRaw.!type: fn(type: string, fn: string, value: string) -> string

interpret.!type: fn(text: string, interpreter?: string, sink?: string) -> ?

say.!type: fn(text: string, interpreter?: string, sink?: string, volume?: ?)

Audio.!doc: Audio Actions. The static methods of this class are made available as functions in the scripts. This allows a script to use audio features.

BusEvent.!doc: BusEvent Actions. The static methods of this class are made available as functions in the scripts. This gives direct write access to the openHAB event bus from within scripts. Items should not be updated directly (setting the state property), but updates should be sent to the bus, so that all interested bundles are notified.

Ephemeris.!doc: Ephemeris Actions. The static methods of this class are made available as functions in the scripts. This allows a script to use ephemeris features.

Exec.!doc: Exec Actions. This class provides static methods that can be used in automation rules for executing commands on command line.

HTTP.!doc: HTTP Actions. This class provides static methods that can be used in automation rules for sending HTTP requests.

Log.!doc: Log Actions. The static methods of this class are made available as functions in the scripts. This allows a script to log to the SLF4J-Log.

NotificationAction.!doc: Notification Actions. If the openHAB Cloud Connector is installed, notifications can be sent to registered users/devices.

Ping.!doc: Ping Actions. This Action checks the vitality of the given host.

ScriptExecution.!doc: ScriptExecution Actions. The static methods of this class are made available as functions in the scripts. This allows a script to call another script, which is available as a file.

Semantics.!doc: Semantics Actions. The static methods of this class are made available as functions in the scripts. This allows a script to use Semantics features.

Things.!doc: Things Actions. This class provides static methods that can be used in automation rules for getting thing's status info.

Transformation.!doc: Transformation Actions. The static methods of this class allow rules to execute transformations using one of the various data transformation services.

Voice.!doc: Voice Actions. The static methods of this class are made available as functions in the scripts. This allows a script to use voice features.

thingActions.!doc: Get the ThingActions of a given Thing.

items.!doc: Items namespace. This namespace handles querying and updating openHAB Items.

things.!doc: Things namespace. This namespace handles querying and updating openHAB Things.

cache.!doc: Cache namespace. This namespace provides caches that can be used to set and retrieve objects that will be persisted between reloads of scripts.

log.!doc: Creates a logger with the specified name.

actions.!doc: Actions namespace. This namespace provides access to openHAB actions. All available actions can be accessed as direct properties of this object (via their simple class name).

time.!doc: Exports the excellent JS-Joda library which is a port of java.time which is used by openHAB.

console.!doc: Supports the standard console object for logging. Script debug logging is enabled by default at the TRACE level, but can be configured using the console logging commands.

setTimeout.!doc: The global setTimeout() method sets a timer which executes a function or specified piece of code once the timer expires.

clearTimeout.!doc: The global clearTimeout() method cancels a timeout previously established by calling setTimeout().

setInterval.!doc: The setInterval() method repeatedly calls a function or executes a code snippet, with a fixed time delay between each call.

clearInterval.!doc: The global clearInterval() method cancels a timed, repeating action which was previously established by a call to setInterval().

require.!doc: Scripts may include standard NPM based libraries by using CommonJS require. The library search path will look in automation/js/node_modules in the user configuration directory.

event.!doc: Data passed from triggers. Attention: Java types (see JS Scripting docs/UI Based Rules/Event Object)!
